title: Puppeteer - Freeware music making software
description:
P U P P E T E E R
-----------------

By Rufus - [ <a class="__cf_email__" href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" data-cfemail="c290b7a4b7b1ec96aaadb0aca782a5afa3abaeeca1adaf">[email&#160;protected]</a><script data-cfhash='f9e31' type="text/javascript">
/* <![CDATA[ */!function(){try{var t="currentScript"in document?document.currentScript:function(){for(var t=document.getElementsByTagName("script"),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute("data-cfhash"))return t[e]}();if(t&&t.previousSibling){var e,r,n,i,c=t.previousSibling,a=c.getAttribute("data-cfemail");if(a){for(e="",r=parseInt(a.substr(0,2),16),n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)i=parseInt(a.substr(n,2),16)^r,e+=String.fromCharCode(i);e=document.createTextNode(e),c.parentNode.replaceChild(e,c)}t.parentNode.removeChild(t);}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */</script> ] - Version 2.7 Alpha



Puppeteer is a freeware audio mixing, scratching and beatboxing tool similar to eJay. Over two thousand music samples are included for you to mess around with, in addition to voice samples of famous people like George W Bush and Tony Blair.


Downloading this program is not illegal, since I am the author of this software.



I want to get this out onto the internet. *EVERYONE* who has used it has been blown away. It has been successfully used at parties to entertain large numbers of people, and it has been used in bedroom recording-studios.
Please, please please download this and let me know what you think. I am Rufus Thorne, and I am the author of this software. It has taken me years to make this, and I need public feedback.



Usage is incredibly simple; start the program, click on 'Modules' and select a grid of buttons, open ass many of them as you like. Combine them with the 'Deck Tool' for looping background beats (need to look in the SampleMusic folder, see below)

Play the drums with the computer keyboard! - Puppeteer features a full 25-key drum machine:

A = Kick Drum 	E = Snare

Try the rest out. When you get tired, there are fifty built-in drum patterns that will play on a loop, for you to combine your samples with.

Please e-mail me your comments. Source-code is available on request.


Notes and Bugs:
---------------------

Shortcuts are not created in this build. To launch the program, you will have to go to the install directory (typically Program Files/Puppeteer)
There are a few small bugs in this version, which I am attempting to work on in my spare time. Email me your bug reports.

The audio tools within this program will need paths-to-SampleMusic setting up.
The path is typically Program Files/Puppeteer/SampleMusic.

Program behaviour can sometimes be erratic under Vista. Right clicking on the shortcut and selecting 'disable desktop composition' will help this.

Puppeteer was designed to run with screen resolution 1024x768 and above


*NOTE*
Up to 1000MB Temporary hard-disk space is required by Puppeteer when it is running. If you find playback and/or responsiveness to be sluggish, free up some more disk-space.
